Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir,

After considerable travel discomfort due to the great shortage of horses in these parts, I arrived on the 4th of the current month to this district of Vacaria, having the satisfaction, however, of finding everything in peace, as well as favorable news from São Paulo, for which reason it seems to me for now unnecessary the march of Lieutenant-Colonel Rodrigo, and sufficient the company of Captain José Antônio de Oliveira, who marched with me and whom I leave positioned at Antas, at the Passo de Cima, in this district, until my return from Lages to which I set out today, where I was able to obtain some horses in very poor condition, to proceed slowly marching; and from there, with better information, I will report to Your Excellency Cima da Serra, as this one, they are found in the most lamentable state possible, both in horses and cattle, which are only found in a few places.
